Title: [Remote] Product/UX Designer
Description:
Note: The job is a remote job and is open to candidates in USA. Henry Schein One is the global leader in dental management, analytics, communication, and marketing software. They are seeking a Product/UX Designer who will be responsible for solving customer problems and designing intuitive experiences within their Clinical, AI, and Imaging workflows while collaborating with product managers and engineers.

Responsibilities
• Champion user-centered design by deeply understanding customer needs, pain points, and behaviors through research, interviews, and usability testing.
• Take ownership of the design process for assigned features — from early concepts and prototyping to creating high-fidelity UI designs and clear design specifications
• Collaborate closely with product managers and engineers, ensuring a seamless and iterative design process that integrates feedback at every stage
• Balance user needs with business goals, making strategic design decisions that drive both usability and impact
• Participate in design critiques, brainstorming sessions, and workshops to share ideas and continuously improve the design process
• Support and contribute to voice-of-customer research and usability assessments, applying insights to improve user experiences
• Collaborate with and support junior designers when needed, sharing feedback and best practices

Skills
• 3-5 years of experience designing and delivering top-tier B2B software products in a product design role
• Experience across the full design lifecycle: from problem discovery through data and research, to solution ideation, prototyping, user testing, and iteration
• Ability to design end-to-end user experiences, focusing on seamless journeys and intuitive interactions
• A customer-first mindset with a passion for identifying and solving user pain points, and engaging directly with users to ensure we’re building what truly meets their needs
• A growth-oriented, self-aware designer who is eager to learn, improve, and adapt
• Experience working closely with product managers and engineers
• Familiarity with web and mobile design best practices, plus a working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals
• Proficiency in industry-standard design tools such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, and/or Adobe Creative Cloud
• Experience using and contributing to design systems, including style guides, components, and interaction patterns
• All submissions should include a link to your portfolio as part of consideration for this role
• Bachelor’s Degree in Design or Human Factors
• Experience in the medical or dental industry, bringing valuable industry insights to the table

Benefits
• Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
• 401K Plan with Company Match
• Paid Time Off (PTO)
• Sick Leave (if applicable)
• Paid Parental Leave
• Short Term Disability
• Income Protection
• Work Life Assistance Program
• Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts
• Education Benefits
• Worldwide Scholarship Program
• Volunteer Opportunities
• And more

Company Overview
• Henry Schein One is the world's largest dental practice management software company. It was founded in 2018, and is headquartered in American Fork, Utah, USA, with a workforce of 1001-5000 employees. Its website is http://www.henryscheinone.com/.

Title: Senior UX/UI Designer, Unannounced Game
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 300 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

We’re seeking a highly-skilled Senior UX/UI Designer to join an in-house development team focused on an innovative game delivered directly to TV via Netflix’s proprietary cloud streaming platform. In this role, you will take full end-to-end ownership of developing core interaction and experience design for a dual-screen game that will immerse players in a beloved IP franchise.

The ideal candidate will act as an Informed Captain, skillfully gaining consensus and buy-in, communicating complex ideas, and ensuring seamless execution from concept to launch. Your industry-leading craft expertise, meticulous attention to detail, and proactive curiosity will enable you to generate immersive experiences that are fun and intuitive for players with a wide range of gaming familiarity. Your technical skills will be essential in creating new UX features in-engine, empowering you and other team members to develop innovative gameplay moments that captivate members.

THE TEAM

We’re a small, scrappy team with big ambitions and an obsession to deliver memorable, innovative gameplay combined with beloved IPs, served seamlessly within the Netflix streaming ecosystem. We’re looking for new teammates who care deeply about the experiences they create and the people they make them with, who are biased towards action, and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace. As part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Innovative Designer: Design and prototype engaging game UI using industry-standard tools like Miro, Adobe Creative Suite, and Figma, ensuring intuitive and satisfying player interactions.
• Technical Implementer: Utilize your technical skills to implement UI features directly in-engine, ensuring seamless integration and ownership over the UX we ship to our members.
• Quality Champion: Advocate for execution quality in your various areas of expertise and influence, ensuring that all deliverables meet the highest standards. Mentor and guide team designers on UX/UI craft excellence. Direct and collaborate with outsource partners and vendors to achieve exceptional UX/UI execution quality.
• Collaborative Leader: Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to guide the development and refinement of key features, screens, and menus, ensuring a cohesive and extraordinary player experience from sketches through full implementation. Drive UX vision across disciplines, acting as an Informed Captain, even when other leads may disagree.
• Experience Advocate: Collaborate with leadership to establish experiential vision, goals, and quality metrics, driving a unified player experience across all game features and systems.
• Communication Specialist: You will be responsible for enhancing cohesion and clarity in outward-facing materials, such as creative briefs and stakeholder review decks, to convey our creative vision effectively.
• Artistic Vision: Partner with Creative and Art leads to produce mockups, prototypes, or videos that help drive and align UX/UI with the product's holistic artistic vision.
• Cultural Beacon: Serve as a constant source of inspiration and advocacy, pushing the team to achieve the best work of their lives by helping foster a culture of excellence and creativity.
• Member-Focused: Act as a bridge between our members, Consumer Insights, and core dev teams. Gather and present materials that align the team’s vision with broader business goals and member needs, initiating new research and insights where there are gaps.
• Right-Sizer: Balance schedules, budgets, and experience aspirations with data and your deep production experience. Help organize project scheduling along with staffing and outsourcing needs.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE
• Has 5+ years of progressively complex, related experience in UX/UI design, with a proven track record of shipping multiple games in a UX/UI design-focused role.
• Possesses a deep understanding of game design theory and practices, especially as it relates to UX/UI, approachability, controls, and interaction
• Is experienced in designing for mobile and touch devices—bonus for second-screen experiences.
• Can produce baseline mock-ups, especially in early prototyping stages, without additional UI art support
• Is capable and well-versed in basic scripting and/or C# to implement UX directly in-engine, in Unity, or similar game engines
• Thrives as a member of a cross-functional multidisciplinary team
• Communicates with authenticity, intention, and curiosity
• Gets excited by learning new skills, dashing to pitch in, even if this means flexing beyond this role’s core responsibilities, if it can help us win
• Plays broadly across multiple games of varied genres
• Works effectively off-site on shared projects

LOCATION
• Los Angeles preferred
• Will consider remote applicants who are willing to travel for work-related events and work a PST-oriented dev team schedule.

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $260,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits, including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Job is open for no less than 7 days and will be removed when the position is filled.

Title: UX Designer, YouTube Connected TV Experience
Description:
📍 Job Overview

Job Title: UX Designer, YouTube Connected TV Experience
Company: Google
Location: California, United States
Job Type: Full-Time
Category: UX/Product Design
Date Posted: October 30, 2025
Experience Level: Mid-Senior Level (4-8 years)
Remote Status: On-site

🚀 Role Summary
• Drive the end-to-end design of user journeys and key features for YouTube's Connected TV experience, focusing on live sports, movies, and shows.
• Conceptualize and deliver wireframes, mockups, and high-fidelity prototypes across TV, mobile, and web platforms, ensuring a seamless user experience.
• Champion user-centered design principles and collaborate closely with Product Management, Engineering, and UX Research to translate user insights into impactful product improvements.
• Contribute to the evolution of the Google design language and maintain design consistency across the broader YouTube ecosystem.

📝 Enhancement Note: While the title is "UX Designer," the responsibilities and focus on "Connected TV Experience" and "YouTube" indicate a specialized role within product design, with a strong emphasis on user interface and interaction design for a large-scale consumer-facing platform. The role requires not just design execution but also strategic input to influence product direction.

📈 Primary Responsibilities
• Design comprehensive user journeys and critical features for the YouTube Connected TV platform, encompassing live sports, movies, and shows.
• Develop detailed wireframes, user interface mockups, and high-fidelity interactive prototypes for various platforms including smart TVs, mobile devices, and web browsers.
• Clearly articulate design concepts, user flows, and interaction specifications through compelling scenarios, storyboards, and presentations.
• Foster strong collaborative relationships with Product Management, Engineering, and UX Research teams to ensure user-centered design solutions are effectively implemented.
• Partner with UX Research to define research hypotheses and leverage user insights to drive iterative design improvements and product enhancements.
• Advocate for user-focused design principles and contribute to the overall UX strategy, ensuring alignment and consistency with the Google design language and the YouTube product ecosystem.
• Proactively identify opportunities to innovate and enhance the streaming experience on Connected TV devices.

📝 Enhancement Note: The responsibilities highlight a need for a designer who can handle both strategic vision and detailed execution. The emphasis on "end-to-end designs" and "articulate design ideas" suggests a role requiring strong communication and presentation skills, in addition to core design competencies.

🎓 Skills & Qualifications

Education:
• Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
• Master's degree in a related field is preferred, indicating a desire for advanced theoretical understanding and research capabilities.

Experience:
• Minimum of 4 years of dedicated experience in interaction design, product design, or UX design roles.
• Proven experience in creating, implementing, and defining design systems, ensuring consistency and scalability across products.
• Demonstrable experience with visual design principles and application within product or UX design contexts.
• Extensive experience designing consumer-facing products, with a strong understanding of user behavior and engagement patterns.
• Experience specifically with interactive TV or streaming products is preferred, showcasing domain-specific knowledge.

Required Skills:
• Interaction Design: Deep understanding of user interaction principles and ability to translate user needs into intuitive interfaces.
• Product Design: Holistic approach to product development, considering user experience, business goals, and technical feasibility.
• Design Systems: Proficiency in working with and contributing to design systems for scalable and consistent product experiences.
• Visual Design: Strong aesthetic sensibility and ability to create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces.
• User-Centered Design: Commitment to user advocacy throughout the design process, utilizing research and testing.
• Prototyping: Skill in creating interactive prototypes using various UX design tools to test and communicate design concepts.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with diverse teams including Product Managers, Engineers, and Researchers.
• Consumer-Facing Products: Experience designing for a broad consumer audience with diverse needs and technical proficiencies.

Preferred Skills:
• Interactive TV/Streaming Products: Specific experience designing for smart TV interfaces, streaming applications, or digital media platforms.
• Multi-Platform Design: Experience designing user experiences that span TV, mobile, and desktop environments, understanding platform-specific constraints and opportunities.
• Strategic Design Thinking: Ability to balance immediate design tasks with long-term product vision and strategic influence.
• UX Research Partnership: Experience collaborating with researchers to formulate hypotheses and interpret findings.
• Advanced Prototyping Tools: Familiarity with a wide array of UX design and prototyping software.

📝 Enhancement Note: The "4 years of interaction design experience" coupled with a Bachelor's degree sets the expectation for a mid-level to senior designer capable of independent work and strategic contribution. The preference for Master's degrees and specific TV/streaming experience suggests that candidates with deeper academic or specialized industry knowledge will be highly valued.

📊 Process & Systems Portfolio Requirements

Portfolio Essentials:
• Showcase end-to-end design projects, demonstrating your process from problem definition to final solution.
• Include case studies that highlight your interaction design, visual design, and prototyping skills.
• Provide examples of your work with design systems, illustrating how you contributed to or utilized them.
• Present projects that clearly define user problems, your design rationale, and the impact of your solutions.

Process Documentation:
• Projects should clearly articulate the design process followed, including user research, ideation, wireframing, prototyping, and user testing phases.
• Demonstrate how you leveraged user insights and data to inform design decisions and iterate on solutions.
• Illustrate your ability to collaborate with engineering and product management, showing how you translated designs into implemented features.
• Highlight contributions to or creation of design systems, detailing their structure and application.

📝 Enhancement Note: A strong portfolio is critical for this role. It should not only display polished final designs but also a clear, repeatable process for tackling complex design challenges, especially within a large-scale consumer product environment like YouTube. The emphasis on design systems and cross-functional collaboration is key.

💵 Compensation & Benefits

Salary Range:
• Base Salary: $129,000 - $185,000 USD per year.
• Additional Compensation: This range reflects base salary only and does not include potential bonuses, equity grants, or other benefits.
• Methodology: This range is determined by role, level, and location, with individual pay influenced by factors like job-related skills, experience, and education. The provided range is a benchmark for a mid-to-senior level UX Designer in California, USA, considering Google's compensation structure for such roles.

Benefits:
• Bonus: Potential for performance-based bonuses.
• Equity: Opportunity to receive stock options or grants.
• Comprehensive Benefits Package: Includes health insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement savings plans (e.g., 401k), paid time off (vacation, sick leave, holidays), parental leave, and other employee support programs.
• Professional Development: Access to learning resources, training, and conferences to foster skill growth.
• Employee Perks: Potential for on-site amenities, wellness programs, and employee assistance programs.

Working Hours:
• Standard full-time position, typically 40 hours per week.
• While core hours are expected, Google often offers flexibility for employees to manage their schedules, provided work objectives and collaboration needs are met.

📝 Enhancement Note: The salary range provided is a guideline for the base salary. The total compensation package, including bonus and equity, can significantly increase the overall remuneration for this role at Google. The specific range for the candidate's location within California will be discussed during the hiring process.

🎯 Team & Company Context

🏢 Company Culture

Industry: Technology, Software, Digital Media, Entertainment. Google operates at the forefront of innovation in search, cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and digital advertising, with YouTube being a dominant force in online video content and streaming.

Company Size: Google is a massive global organization with tens of thousands of employees, categorized as "Large" (10,000+ employees). This provides ample resources, opportunities for specialization, and a vast network for collaboration.

Founded: Google was founded in 1998. Its long history has established a culture of innovation, data-driven decision-making, and a focus on user experience. The company ethos, "Focus on the user and all else will follow," is central to its product development.

Team Structure:
• User Experience (UX) Team: Comprised of multi-disciplinary professionals including UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers.
• Reporting: This role likely reports to a Design Lead or Manager within the YouTube UX organization, with a direct reporting line to a manager overseeing specific product areas.
• Collaboration: The UX team works in close partnership with Product Management and Engineering teams, fostering a highly collaborative environment where design is integrated into the product development lifecycle from conception to launch.

Methodology:
• User-Centered Design: A core philosophy that guides all product development, ensuring user needs and behaviors are paramount.
• Data-Informed Decisions: Heavy reliance on analytics, A/B testing, and user research to validate hypotheses and drive product improvements.
• Agile Development: Iterative design and development processes that allow for rapid prototyping, testing, and refinement.
• Design Systems: Utilization and evolution of comprehensive design systems to ensure consistency, efficiency, and scalability across Google's vast product suite.

Company Website: https://www.google.com, https://www.youtube.com/about/

📝 Enhancement Note: Google's culture is characterized by innovation, a data-driven approach, and a strong emphasis on user experience. The scale of operations means that design decisions have a massive impact, and there's a significant focus on scalability and consistency through design systems.

📈 Career & Growth Analysis

Operations Career Level: This role sits at a mid-to-senior level within the UX design discipline. It requires not only strong execution skills but also the ability to influence product strategy and contribute to the long-term vision of the YouTube Connected TV experience.

Reporting Structure: The designer will likely report to a Design Manager and collaborate closely with Product Managers and Engineering Leads on specific feature development. There will be opportunities to influence design direction for the broader team and contribute to cross-functional initiatives.

Operations Impact: The designer's impact will be direct and significant, shaping how billions of users interact with YouTube on their primary entertainment devices. Success will be measured by user engagement, satisfaction, retention, and the adoption of new features and content within the streaming ecosystem.

Growth Opportunities:
• Skill Specialization: Deepen expertise in designing for TV interfaces, streaming media, and large-scale consumer platforms.
• Leadership Development: Opportunities to mentor junior designers, lead design initiatives for specific features, and influence design strategy.
• Cross-Functional Leadership: Develop stronger partnerships with Product Management and Engineering, taking on more strategic roles in product planning.
• Platform Expansion: Potentially contribute to design efforts across other Google products or platforms, leveraging core skills.
• Industry Recognition: Work on high-impact projects that contribute to Google's reputation as a leader in UX design and digital media.

📝 Enhancement Note: The role offers a clear path for growth within UX design, moving from execution to strategic leadership. The scale and impact of YouTube provide unparalleled opportunities for professional development and career advancement within the tech industry.

🌐 Work Environment

Office Type: This is an on-site role, implying a traditional office environment at one of Google's California campuses. These campuses are known for fostering collaboration, innovation, and providing extensive amenities.

Office Location(s): California, United States. Specific office location (e.g., Mountain View, Sunnyvale) will be confirmed during the hiring process. These locations are hubs for Google's product development and offer vibrant working environments.

Workspace Context:
• Collaborative Spaces: Offices are designed with a mix of open-plan areas, meeting rooms, and private spaces to support different work styles and collaboration needs.
• Tools & Technology: Access to state-of-the-art hardware, software, and internal tools necessary for high-quality UX design, including advanced design and prototyping software, and robust internal development environments.
• Team Interaction: Frequent opportunities for face-to-face interaction with design peers, product managers, engineers, and researchers to foster rapid iteration and problem-solving.
• Amenities: Google campuses typically offer extensive amenities such as cafes, fitness centers, recreation areas, and quiet zones, supporting employee well-being and productivity.

Work Schedule: Standard 40-hour work week, with flexibility in daily scheduling as long as collaboration and project timelines are met. The on-site requirement emphasizes the importance of in-person collaboration and team integration.

📝 Enhancement Note: The on-site requirement suggests a preference for fostering strong team cohesion and enabling spontaneous collaboration, which is often valued in fast-paced product development environments. The California locations are major tech hubs with excellent infrastructure and resources.

📄 Application & Portfolio Review Process

Interview Process:
• Initial Screening: A recruiter will review your application and portfolio.
• Hiring Manager/Recruiter Call: A brief discussion to assess basic qualifications, cultural fit, and interest.
• Design Portfolio Review: A dedicated session where you present your portfolio to a panel of designers and/or product managers. This is a critical stage to showcase your process, skills, and impact.
• On-site/Virtual Interviews: A series of interviews (typically 3-5) focusing on:
• Design Skills & Process: Deep dives into your portfolio projects, design thinking, and problem-solving approaches.
• Technical & System Design: Questions related to design systems, cross-platform design, and technical constraints.
• Collaboration & Communication: Assessing your ability to work with cross-functional teams and articulate your ideas.
• Behavioral Questions: Understanding your past experiences, how you handle challenges, and your alignment with Google's culture.
• Hiring Committee Review: Your interview feedback is compiled and reviewed by a committee for a final hiring decision.

Portfolio Review Tips:
• Curate Strategically: Select 3-4 projects that best showcase your interaction design, visual design, and problem-solving skills, with a focus on consumer-facing products and ideally, TV or streaming experiences.
• Tell a Story: For each project, clearly articulate the problem, your role, the design process, key decisions, challenges, and the measurable impact of your work.
• Show, Don't Just Tell: Use wireframes, mockups, interactive prototypes, and user flows to visually communicate your design thinking.
• Highlight Process: Emphasize your user-centered approach, how you incorporated user feedback, and how you collaborated with teams.
• Design Systems Focus: If you have experience with design systems, dedicate a section or project to demonstrating your understanding and contribution.
• Be Prepared for Questions: Anticipate questions about your design rationale, trade-offs made, and how you would approach similar problems in the future.

Challenge Preparation:
• Understand the Context: Be ready for potential design challenges or exercises that might simulate real-world problems related to YouTube's Connected TV experience.
• Focus on Process: Even if given a short timeframe, demonstrate your structured approach to problem-solving, ideation, and solutioning.
• Articulate Your Thinking: Clearly communicate your thought process, assumptions, and rationale behind your design choices.
• Consider Constraints: Be mindful of technical limitations, business goals, and the user experience when proposing solutions.

📝 Enhancement Note: The interview process at Google is rigorous and emphasizes a combination of design craft, strategic thinking, collaboration, and cultural fit. A well-prepared, compelling portfolio presentation is paramount.

🛠 Tools & Technology Stack

Primary Tools:
• Design & Prototyping Software: Proficiency in industry-standard tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator), and prototyping tools like InVision, Principle, or Framer is expected. Figma is widely used at Google for its collaborative capabilities.
• Wireframing Tools: Tools like Balsamiq, Axure, or even basic digital whiteboarding tools for early-stage ideation.
• User Flow Tools: Tools to map out user journeys and interaction sequences.

Analytics & Reporting:
• Familiarity with data analysis and reporting tools is beneficial, as designers are expected to understand user behavior and measure the impact of their designs. This may include tools like Google Analytics, Tableau, Looker, or internal Google analytics platforms.

CRM & Automation:
• While not the primary focus for a UX Designer, understanding how user data is managed and how design impacts user journeys within CRM systems (like Salesforce, though less likely directly used by designers) and marketing automation platforms can provide valuable context.

Collaboration & Project Management:
• Internal Google Tools: Experience with Google's internal suite of collaboration and project management tools (e.g., Google Workspace, internal bug tracking systems, project management software) is a plus.
• Version Control: Understanding principles of version control, especially for design assets and system components, can be advantageous.

📝 Enhancement Note: While the job description doesn't explicitly list tools, Google is a heavy user of Figma for design collaboration. Demonstrating proficiency with modern, collaborative design tools and an understanding of how design integrates with data and development workflows is crucial.

👥 Team Culture & Values

Operations Values:
• User Focus: A fundamental principle at Google, ensuring that user needs, satisfaction, and experience are at the forefront of all design decisions.
• Innovation: A culture that encourages experimentation, creative problem-solving, and pushing the boundaries of technology and design.
• Collaboration: Strong emphasis on teamwork, open communication, and cross-functional partnerships to achieve shared goals.
• Data-Driven Approach: Utilizing data and insights from user research and analytics to inform design choices and measure success.
• Excellence & Quality: A commitment to delivering high-quality, polished, and impactful products that set industry standards.
• Inclusivity: Designing for a global audience with diverse needs and backgrounds, ensuring accessibility and equitable experiences.

Collaboration Style:
• Integrated Teams: Designers work as integral parts of product teams, closely aligned with Product Managers and Engineers.
• Open Feedback: A culture of constructive feedback is encouraged, with regular design critiques and peer reviews to refine work.
• Knowledge Sharing: Active participation in design communities of practice, sharing learnings, and contributing to the broader design knowledge base within Google.
• Agile & Iterative: Collaborative efforts are often structured around agile methodologies, allowing for rapid iteration and continuous improvement.

📝 Enhancement Note: The culture values initiative, collaboration, and a relentless pursuit of user satisfaction and product excellence. Designers are expected to be proactive, communicative, and willing to embrace a data-informed, iterative design process.

⚡ Challenges & Growth Opportunities

Challenges:
• Designing for Scale: Creating intuitive and engaging experiences for billions of users across diverse devices and contexts requires meticulous attention to detail and a deep understanding of user behavior.
• Balancing Stakeholder Needs: Effectively navigating the needs and priorities of various stakeholders (Product, Engineering, Marketing, Legal) while remaining a strong advocate for the user.
• Rapid Technological Evolution: Staying ahead of evolving technologies in streaming, AI, and interactive media to ensure YouTube's Connected TV experience remains cutting-edge.
• Maintaining Design Consistency: Ensuring a cohesive and branded user experience across multiple platforms and product surfaces within the vast YouTube ecosystem.
• Impact Measurement: Quantifying the impact of design decisions on user engagement, retention, and business objectives can be complex.

Learning & Development Opportunities:
• Specialized Training: Access to internal and external training programs focused on advanced UX techniques, emerging design trends, and platform-specific design challenges.
• Mentorship Programs: Opportunities to be mentored by senior designers or to mentor junior talent, fostering leadership and skill development.
• Industry Conferences & Workshops: Participation in leading design conferences and workshops to stay abreast of industry best practices and network with peers.
• Cross-Functional Exposure: Gaining deeper insights into product management, engineering processes, and user research methodologies through close collaboration.
• Design System Contribution: Opportunities to contribute to and evolve Google's extensive design systems, enhancing expertise in scalable design solutions.

📝 Enhancement Note: The challenges presented are typical of large-scale tech companies and offer significant opportunities for professional growth. Tackling these challenges will build valuable experience in designing for global audiences and influencing product strategy.

💡 Interview Preparation

Strategy Questions:
• Design Process & Rationale: Be prepared to walk through your portfolio projects in detail, explaining your design process, the problems you solved, the decisions you made, and why. Focus on user-centered methodologies.
• Problem-Solving: Expect hypothetical scenarios related to YouTube's Connected TV experience. Articulate how you would approach diagnosing the problem, gathering insights, and proposing solutions.
• Collaboration & Influence: Describe situations where you had to collaborate with difficult stakeholders or influence product direction. Highlight your communication and negotiation skills.

Company & Culture Questions:
• Google/YouTube Understanding: Research Google's mission, YouTube's role in the digital media landscape, and the specific focus on Connected TV and streaming. Understand the "Focus on the user" principle.
• Teamwork & Values: Prepare examples that demonstrate your ability to work collaboratively, handle feedback, and align with Google's values of innovation, user focus, and data-driven decision-making.
• Impact & Metrics: Discuss how you measure the success of your designs and your understanding of key UX metrics relevant to streaming platforms (e.g., watch time, engagement, retention, conversion).

Portfolio Presentation Strategy:
• Structure: Organize your presentation logically, typically starting with an overview, then diving into 2-3 key projects. For each project, clearly define the problem, your role, the process, your solutions, and the outcomes/impact.
• Visuals: Use high-quality visuals – wireframes, mockups, prototypes, user flows. Ensure they are clear, concise, and effectively communicate your design intent.
• Storytelling: Frame your projects as stories. What was the challenge? How did you overcome it? What was the result?
• Conciseness: Be mindful of time. Practice your presentation to ensure you cover the most important points effectively within the allotted time.
• Engagement: Be ready to answer in-depth questions about your design choices and be open to discussing alternative approaches.

📝 Enhancement Note: Preparation is key. Understand the role's specific focus on Connected TV and YouTube. Practice articulating your design process and impact clearly and concisely, as this will be heavily scrutinized during portfolio reviews and interviews.

📌 Application Steps

To apply for this UX Designer position:
• Submit your application through the official Google Careers portal link provided. Ensure all required fields are completed accurately.
• Portfolio Customization: Tailor your portfolio to highlight projects demonstrating interaction design, visual design, and experience with consumer-facing products, ideally with a focus on TV or streaming interfaces. Emphasize your design process and problem-solving approach.
• Resume Optimization: Ensure your resume clearly articulates your 4+ years of relevant UX/product design experience, highlighting achievements and skills using keywords from the job description (e.g., Design Systems, Prototyping, Consumer-Facing Products).
• Interview Preparation: Thoroughly review potential interview questions focusing on design process, problem-solving, collaboration, and your portfolio. Practice presenting your case studies clearly and concisely.
• Company Research: Deepen your understanding of Google's culture, YouTube's mission, and the specific challenges and opportunities within the Connected TV streaming space.

⚠️ Important Notice: This enhanced job description includes AI-generated insights and operations industry-standard assumptions. All details should be verified directly with the hiring organization before making application decisions.

Title: UI UX Design Manager - Figma - Voluntary - Unpaid
Description:
Hello,

Company Description

The Tann Mann Gaadi is a "Not for Profit" trust venture dedicated to addressing the serious health risks associated with open defecation in developing countries by building Wellness on wheels. We aim to integrate technology with our social cause, providing a holistic approach to social responsibility through health, sensitization, safety, and eco-friendly solutions.
Please do visit https://TheTannMannGaadi.Org .

Role Description

This is a volunteer, remote role for a Chief UI UX Design - Figma - UX Writer. The Chief UI UX Design will be responsible for developing visual designs and mockups, creating and improving user interfaces, ensuring a positive user experience, and potentially engaging in front-end development tasks. This role contributes to the design and user experience of various digital products linked to our mission.

Qualifications

Proficiency in Visual Design and creating Mockups
Strong skills in User Interface Design and User Experience (UX)
Experience in Front-End Development
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Ability to work independently and remotely
Passion for social causes and creating impactful solutions
Previous experience with Fashion Industry and software would be useful.
Knowledge of Figma is essential.
5-20 years of experience would be useful.
This is an unpaid part time work from home opportunity. No money, no travel.

You will get an opportunity to work with a global team with award winning leaders. You will get an experience letter based on the time you invest. You would need to invest at least 8 hours a week ( flexible timings) for 3 months to get an experience letter. More time you invest, more you grow.

Does this excite you ?

This is an unpaid opportunity. No money. No salary. Work from home. Few hours a week (8-12 flexible hours a week, no fixed timings).

We have Senior UI UX designer, UX writer, UI Designer and UX designer opportunities.

Thanks,
Team The Tann Mann Foundation

Title: 🧩 UI/UX Designer (Part-Time to Full-Time) for Website & Mobile App – Home Service Platform
Description:
Opening / Hook:

We’re looking for a designer who truly cares about how users feel when they interact with a product — someone who loves clean, modern design and wants to help us build a home service platform that’s simple, intuitive, and delightful to use.

Description:

We’re an Australia-based Home Service company looking for a creative and reliable UI/UX Designer to join our growing team.

Our platform connects customers with professional cleaners and other home service providers. We’re currently updating our website and mobile app (iOS & Android) — adding new functions and improving the user experience for both customers and service providers.

We’re looking for someone who can collaborate closely with our tech team, bring strong design ideas, and help us build a seamless, modern, and user-friendly platform.

Responsibilities:

• Redesign and enhance our website layout, flow, and visual style.

• Improve app UI/UX for both customer and provider sides.

• Create wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes.

• Collaborate with developers to ensure smooth implementation.

• Continuously refine UI/UX based on user feedback and analytics.

Requirements:

• Proven experience in UI/UX design for both web and mobile.

• Proficiency in Figma, Adobe XD, or similar tools.

• Strong understanding of responsive design and user-centered design principles.

• Experience in service-based or booking platforms (preferred).

• Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.

Part-Time to Full-Time (depending on performance)

Title: UI/UX Designer (CONTRACT)
Description:
CONTRACT ROLE

Insomniac's UI/UX Department is looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer to help us build our next industry-inspiring player experience. In this role, you will partner with a world-class UI/UX team to help players navigate, locate information, and accomplish their goals, all while maximizing the end-user experience by prioritizing usability and accessibility.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:
• Create AAA quality user interface designs for in game HUD and menu systems.
• Work iteratively and independently through all phases of the game development cycle from prototype to polish.
• Collaborate directly with artists, designers, developers, and researchers to create and design accessible user experiences that support the aesthetic, experiential, and technical vision for our games.
• Provide accurate estimates for tasks, regularly update the team on in progress work, and ensure work remains is in scope.
• Deliver wireframes, mockups, prototypes, and the in-game implementation of assets that are usable, accessible, and highly refined.
• Proactively share, receive, incorporate, and act on feedback.
• Effectively communicate with leadership and project management to manage reasonable workload and maintain a healthy work-life balance.
• Help evolve our studio’s standards of excellence for UI/UX design.
• Advocate for our players and the end-to-end user experience.
• Other duties may be assigned.

Education and/or Experience:
• Five or more years of related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Proficiency with screen design and rapid prototyping tools (e.g. Photoshop, Illustrator, Figma or equivalent).
• Detailed understanding of digital interaction design fundamentals and patterns.
• Strong game design sensibilities and commitment to creating innovative player experiences.
• Passion for game accessibility and player advocacy.

Bonus Experience:
• Experience working on UI/UX systems in AAA games.
• Experience with the Adobe suite (Photoshop, Animate, and Illustrator).
• Familiarity with game engines and implementation workflows.
• Familiarity with web technologies (e.g. HTML, CSS, JS).

At Insomniac, we've embraced a digital-first culture, and support in-office, remote and hybrid working arrangements.

Even if you don’t feel like you meet all requirements for this role, we still encourage you to apply. We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting incredible candidates, and we certainly wouldn’t want it to prevent us from meeting you.

Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights.

At SIE, working with our partners, we consider several factors when setting each role’s base pay range, including the competitive benchmarking data for the market and geographic location.

Please note that the individual base pay range may vary based on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location.

In addition, this role is eligible for benefit offerings that include medical, dental, and vision. Click here to learn more.

The estimated base pay range for this role is listed below, this is an hourly rate.
$65—$85 USD

Title: Lead UX Designer - Freelance
Description:
This freelance role is fully remote. Candidates must be based in the United States or Canada.

We are Fantasy.

The creative partner behind the world’s biggest digital products, launching the next generation of intelligent experiences. For over two decades, we’ve partnered with industry leaders like Google, Microsoft, Nike, Spotify, and Ford to shape products and services used by billions daily.

The Role

As a Freelance UX Designer at Fantasy, you’ll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to design meaningful, human-centered digital products and services for global audiences. You’ll create experiences that millions of people not only use — but genuinely enjoy.

You’ll partner with some of the world’s most forward-thinking organizations, including Netflix, Spotify, Asana, The Academy of Motion Pictures, Dolby, Ancestry, Salesforce, and more. Working across a range of industries and form factors — from automotive and travel to AI and voice interfaces — you’ll help define and deliver exceptional digital experiences.

Key Responsibilities
• Guide and contribute to the design process from concept through delivery.
• Partner with cross-functional teams to create thoughtful, human-centered design solutions.
• Translate complex information into clear, actionable design directions.
• Develop product visions, feature sets, and roadmaps that balance user needs with business goals.
• Build and maintain scalable design systems that bring consistency and delight to global audiences.
• Collaborate across disciplines to align strategy and user experience.
• Identify opportunities to improve design processes and team collaboration.
• Lead presentations and discussions with clients and internal partners, communicating design thinking and rationale effectively.
• Build trusted relationships with clients through collaboration, creativity, and problem-solving.
• Contribute to a culture of inclusion, curiosity, and continuous improvement.

Qualifications
• A portfolio that demonstrates a range of digital products, services, or systems design work.
• Ability to demonstrate your process through wireframes, site maps, and flows.
• Approximately 7+ years of professional experience in UX or product design (or equivalent expertise).
• Proven ability to lead or contribute to teams that create human-centered digital experiences.
• Strong conceptual, strategic, and systems-thinking skills.
• Excellent collaboration, communication, and presentation skills.
• Commitment to designing inclusive and accessible digital experiences.

Fantasy EOE

Fantasy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Since 1999, diversity has been vital to our success and ability to create products and services used and loved by millions of people all over the world. We are committed to continually fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace.

Title: Sr. Designer, UX
Description:
Overall Job Summary

This principal purpose of this role is to create, design and implement engaging interactive experiences for our digital customers. This role will assist TSC by providing experiential knowledge on how consumers will use shop for TSC products and solutions. This role is responsible for the creation & delivery of design concepts, detailed wireframes, prototypes, atomic design library and components, & interaction design specifications.

The Senior User Experience Designer will help co-create and evolve the customer experiences for Tractor Supply’s digital properties including our websites and mobile applications. This UX professional has proven experience developing customer facing digital experiences and works well in a cross-functional team.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (Min 5%)
• Review and analyze metrics in order to develop and contribute to continuous improvement, driving a best-in-class customer experience
• Work closely with the cross-functional team to collaboratively design intuitive user experiences
• Ensure design vision is executed consistently across all digital properties including web, mobile web, and mobile applications (iOS & Android).
• Create solutions to complex interface and interaction design challenges. Find intuitive solutions to core user interactions, with an emphasis on usability and customer satisfaction scores.
• Adhere to current SEO industry best practices and design techniques
• Bring user experience design concepts to life by creating deliverables including user flows, wireframes, mocks, and prototypes.
• Design and specify user interfaces and information architecture using participatory and iterative design techniques including customer interviews, usability testing, and other forms of requirements discovery.
• Oversee user research, competitive research, and usability testing throughout the design process including A/B testing of proposed functionality.
• Iterate consistently to arrive at a solution that exceed expectations and create points of digital differentiation.
• Communicate design intent to both internal and external teams with an emphasis on explaining the design approach and advocacy for users’ needs.
• Utilize analytics for continued usability and layout improvements.
• Facilitate and present at design reviews;, presenting storyboards, prototypes and/or finished product.

Required Qualifications

Experience: Minimum of 8 years of experience in user experience design.

Education: Bachelor’s Degree.

Preferred knowledge, skills or abilities
• Experience in development using HTML, CSS, Java, or Dreamweaver and the use of Website Content Management Systems (preferably Adobe, IBM WebSphere, Website Analytics, and/or Open CMS).
• Experience working in Agile (including participation in agile ceremonies)
• Deep understanding of commonly used concepts, practices, technology, and procedures within the field of web and application design, including usability and accessibility standards, user interface design.
• Ability to concisely document and express user experience standards that can be readily understood and applied by both leadership and developers.
• Project Management: Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple concurrent tasks and prioritize projects.
• Familiarity with website segmentation, A/B testing and other optimization techniques.
• Familiarity with analytics tools such as Adobe Test & Target, Usertesting.com.
• Proficiency in MS Office.
• Good oral and written communications skills.
• Data driven, with attention to detail.
• Creative, curious, and proactive strategic thinker.
• Sound judgement and problem solving skills.
• An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job will be considered.

Working Conditions
• Normal office working conditions

Physical Requirements
• Sitting
• Standing (not walking)
• Walking

Disclaimer

This job description represents an overview of the responsibilities for the above referenced position. It is not intended to represent a comprehensive list of responsibilities. A team member should perform all duties as assigned by his/ her supervisor.

Company Info

At Tractor Supply and Petsense by Tractor Supply, our Team Members are the heart of our success. Their dedication, passion, and hard work drive everything we do, and we are committed to supporting them with a comprehensive and accessible total reward package. We understand the evolving needs of our Team Members and their families, and we strive to offer meaningful, competitive, and sustainable benefits that support their well-being today and in the future.

Our benefits extend beyond medical, dental, and vision coverage, including company-paid life and disability insurance, paid parental leave, tuition reimbursement, and family planning resources such as adoption and surrogacy assistance, for all full-time Team Members and all part-time Team Members. Part time new hires gain eligibility for TSC Benefits by averaging at least 15 hours per week during their 90-day lookback period. The lookback period starts the first of the month following the date of hire. If the 15-hour requirement was met, the benefits eligibility date will be the first day of the month following 4 months of continuous service.

Please visit this link for more specific information about the benefits and leave policies applicable to the position you’re applying for.

Title: UX Designer - ISG Client, Vice President
Description:
📍 Job Overview

Job Title: UX Designer - ISG Client, Vice President
Company: Morgan Stanley
Location: Harrison, NY, US
Job Type: FULL_TIME
Category: User Experience (UX) Design / Product Design
Date Posted: 2025-10-28T04:24:58.09
Experience Level: 10+ years
Remote Status: On-site

🚀 Role Summary
• Lead the design strategy and execution for client-facing applications within the Institutional Securities Group (ISG).
• Foster a collaborative design community, ensuring cohesive user experiences and reducing redundant efforts across studios and centers of excellence.
• Act as a strategic partner to senior product and technology stakeholders, influencing project strategy, roadmaps, and design team engagement.
• Drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions by championing design thinking methodologies and best practices within a large, complex organization.

📝 Enhancement Note: This role is positioned at a Vice President level, indicating significant leadership responsibility and strategic influence. The focus on "ISG Client" suggests a specialization in financial services applications, requiring an understanding of complex user workflows and regulatory environments. The emphasis on partnering with senior stakeholders and influencing strategy highlights the need for strong communication, negotiation, and executive presence.

📈 Primary Responsibilities
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including UX Research and Design System COE, to ensure design consistency and reduce duplicated work.
• Provide hands-on design support, including illustrating initial design directions and assisting with deliverables when required.
• Inform project strategy, roadmaps, and design team engagement through cross-departmental collaboration.
• Advise, coach, and course-correct design initiatives to ensure alignment with strategic goals and best practices.
• Build and maintain trusted relationships with senior product and technology stakeholders, positioning UX as a strategic partner.
• Evangelize and promote design thinking methodologies across the organization to foster a culture of innovation.
• Actively participate in group design activities such as brainstorms, audits, critiques, and whiteboard sessions, practicing active listening.
• Manage the team's workload and deliverables effectively, ensuring timely and high-quality output.

📝 Enhancement Note: The responsibilities emphasize both individual contribution ("hands-on design support") and leadership ("advise, coach, and course-correct"). The need to "inform project strategy" and "build and maintain trusted relationships with senior stakeholders" points to a role that requires influencing without direct authority and a strong understanding of business objectives.

🎓 Skills & Qualifications

Education:
• Bachelor's degree in Design, Computer Science, or a related field is required.
• Master's degree in a related field is a plus.

Experience:
• 8+ years of experience as a UX Designer, with a proven track record of contributing to successful product launches.
• At least 3 years of experience managing small to medium-sized design teams.
• Demonstrated experience partnering with multiple departments on successful product releases.

Required Skills:
• Fluency in design thinking methodologies.
• Strong sense of design principles and current design methodologies.
• Proficiency in best practices for utilizing design systems.
• Excellent collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a diverse and creative team.
• Active listening skills and the ability to contribute constructively in group settings.
• High tolerance for ambiguity and the ability to set direction for complex, undefined projects.
• Resilience in the face of obstacles and a persistent drive to validate assumptions and uncover root causes.
• Relentless desire to test, learn, and iterate to uncover problems' root causes.
• Ability to evangelize and promote design thinking within a large organization.
• Experience in stakeholder engagement and building trusted relationships.

Preferred Skills:
• Experience within the financial services industry, particularly with institutional client platforms.
• Advanced proficiency in user research methodologies and usability testing.
• Experience with agile development methodologies.
• Strong visual design and interaction design skills.

📝 Enhancement Note: The requirement for 8+ years of UX design experience and 3+ years of team management, coupled with a VP title, signifies a senior-level role. The emphasis on "ambiguity tolerance," "setting direction," and "uncovering root causes" suggests that candidates will be expected to lead initiatives with evolving requirements and complex challenges. A portfolio demonstrating cross-departmental collaboration on product launches is crucial.

📊 Process & Systems Portfolio Requirements

Portfolio Essentials:
• A comprehensive portfolio demonstrating 8+ years of UX design contributions to successful product releases.
• Evidence of partnering with multiple departments and senior stakeholders on product development lifecycles.
• Case studies showcasing the application of design thinking methodologies to solve complex business problems.
• Examples of how you have managed and mentored design teams, overseeing workload and deliverables.
• Demonstrations of your ability to create cohesive user experiences through collaboration with design systems and research teams.

Process Documentation:
• Showcase experience in defining and documenting design processes, from initial concept to final implementation.
• Highlight your approach to iterative design, including user testing, feedback incorporation, and continuous improvement cycles.
• Provide examples of how you have leveraged design systems to ensure consistency and efficiency in design output.
• Illustrate your methods for collaborating with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to align on project strategy and roadmaps.

📝 Enhancement Note: The portfolio requirements are heavily focused on demonstrating leadership, strategic impact, and the ability to manage complex projects and teams. Candidates should be prepared to articulate their process for problem-solving, stakeholder management, and driving design initiatives within a large organizational structure.

💵 Compensation & Benefits

Salary Range:
The expected base pay rate for this position is between $110,000 and $190,000 USD per year.

Benefits:
Morgan Stanley offers a comprehensive benefits package designed to support employees and their families, including:
• Health insurance (medical, dental, vision)
• Retirement savings plans (e.g., 401(k) with company match)
• Paid time off, including vacation, sick leave, and holidays
• Life and disability insurance
• Employee assistance programs
• Opportunities for professional development and continuing education
• Potential for bonuses and other performance-based incentives
• Access to global office networks and career mobility programs

Working Hours:
The standard working hours for this role are approximately 40 hours per week, reflecting a full-time commitment. However, given the Vice President level and the nature of client-facing financial services, flexibility and dedication may be required to meet project deadlines and stakeholder needs.

📝 Enhancement Note: The provided salary range is a base pay expectation. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as experience, qualifications, location, and business needs. The benefits listed are standard for large financial institutions and are designed to be competitive. The mention of "ample opportunity to move about the business" suggests internal mobility is encouraged.

🎯 Team & Company Context

Industry: Financial Services (Investment Banking, Wealth Management, Investment Management)
Company Size: Over 80,000 employees globally.
Founded: 1935. Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm, providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management, and wealth management services.

Team Structure:

Methodology:

• Active pursuit of validating assumptions through testing, learning, and iteration.

Company Website: https://www.morganstanley.com

📝 Enhancement Note: Morgan Stanley's scale and global presence mean the UX team operates within a large, established enterprise. The culture emphasizes client-first, integrity, and innovation, which will shape the design approach. The "ISG Client" focus suggests a demanding environment where precision, reliability, and security are paramount.

📈 Career & Growth Analysis

Operations Career Level: Vice President (VP) - This is a senior leadership position within the UX design function. It signifies a high level of expertise, strategic responsibility, and influence within the organization.
Reporting Structure: While the direct reporting line isn't specified, the role requires building "trusted relationships with senior product and technology stakeholders," indicating a need for strong collaboration with leadership across different functions. The UX team likely has a dedicated leader, and this VP role may either be that leader or a key senior individual contributor/manager within that team.
Operations Impact: This role has a significant opportunity to impact business decisions by ensuring that client-facing applications are intuitive, efficient, and innovative. By acting as a strategic partner, the UX Designer will influence product roadmaps, drive user-centric innovation, and contribute directly to the success and client satisfaction of the Institutional Securities Group.

Growth Opportunities:

📝 Enhancement Note: The VP title signifies a critical juncture in a UX professional's career, moving beyond execution to strategic leadership and mentorship. 🌐 Work Environment

Office Type: Morgan Stanley operates with a hybrid work model, but this specific role is designated as "On-site," indicating a requirement for regular presence in the Harrison, NY office.

Work Schedule: The standard work schedule is approximately 40 hours per week. As an on-site role at a Vice President level in financial services, there may be expectations for availability beyond typical hours to meet critical deadlines, client needs, or market events.

📝 Enhancement Note: The "On-site" designation for this VP-level role suggests a need for direct collaboration, face-to-face strategic discussions, and active participation in team culture and development initiatives. This is common for senior leadership positions where influencing and mentoring are key.

📄 Application & Portfolio Review Process

Interview Process:
• Initial Screening: HR or recruiter screen to assess basic qualifications, experience, and cultural fit.
• Hiring Manager Interview: Discussion focused on leadership experience, strategic thinking, and team management capabilities.
• Portfolio Presentation: A critical stage where candidates present their portfolio, showcasing case studies, design process, and impact. Expect to discuss specific examples of collaboration, problem-solving, and team leadership.

• Case Study/Design Challenge (Potential): May involve a take-home assignment or an in-person/virtual exercise to evaluate problem-solving skills, design process, and ability to work under pressure.

Portfolio Review Tips:

• Demonstrate Leadership: Clearly articulate your role in managing teams, mentoring designers, and influencing product strategy. Highlight instances where you advised, coached, or course-corrected.

Challenge Preparation:

• Process Articulation: Be ready to clearly explain your design process, decision-making rationale, and how you measure success.
• Communication Clarity: Practice presenting your ideas concisely and persuasively, using visual aids effectively.

📝 Enhancement Note: The portfolio is paramount for this role. Candidates must be prepared to not only showcase their design work but also their strategic thinking, leadership, and ability to drive impact within a complex financial organization. 🛠 Tools & Technology Stack

CRM & Automation:

⚡ Challenges & Growth Opportunities

Challenges:

💡 Interview Preparation

Strategy Questions:

• Focus on Leadership & Strategy: Emphasize your strategic contributions, how you managed the team's workload, and how you influenced stakeholders.
• Demonstrate Design Thinking: Walk through how you identified root causes, validated assumptions, and iterated based on feedback.
• Highlight Collaboration: Explain how you worked with different departments and managed relationships with senior leaders.
• Be Prepared for Q&A: Anticipate questions about your decision-making, challenges, and how you would apply your experience at Morgan Stanley.

📝 Enhancement Note: Interview preparation should focus on demonstrating strategic impact, leadership, and the ability to navigate complex organizational dynamics. Your portfolio should serve as evidence for your responses, showcasing tangible examples of your skills and experience.

📌 Application Steps

To apply for this UX Designer position at Morgan Stanley:

• Tailor Your Resume: Highlight 8+ years of UX design experience and 3+ years of team management. Use keywords from the job description such as "Design Thinking," "Stakeholder Engagement," "Team Management," "Cohesive User Experience," and "Strategic Partner."
• Curate Your Portfolio: Select 3-5 of your strongest case studies that demonstrate strategic leadership, cross-departmental collaboration, and successful product launches. Ensure each case study clearly articulates your process, impact, and team management contributions.
• Prepare Your Presentation: Practice presenting your portfolio, focusing on storytelling, strategic rationale, and measurable outcomes. Be ready to discuss how your experience aligns with Morgan Stanley's values and the ISG client focus.

Title: UI/UX Designer
Description:
Overview

Systems Planning and Analysis, Inc. (SPA) delivers high-impact, technical solutions to complex national security issues. With over 50 years of business expertise and consistent growth, we are known for continuous innovation for our government customers, in both the US and abroad. Our exceptionally talented team is highly collaborative in spirit and practice, producing Results that Matter. Come work with the best! We offer opportunity, unique challenges, and clear-sighted commitment to the mission. SPA: Objective. Responsive. Trusted.

The Joint, Office of the Secretary of Defense, Interagency Division (JOID) provides expert support services to a range of customers spanning across the Department of Defense, Federal Civilian, and international markets. JOID provides a diverse portfolio of analytical and programmatic capabilities to help our customers make informed decisions on their most challenging issues.

SPA's NATO Allied Command Transformation Group, within JOID, provides capability development, portfolio management, program management, quality management, cost estimation analysis, standardization, reporting, software solutions and information management, and capability management support. We also provide an improved capability requirements capture process, including the generation, documentation and tracing of user requirements, with appropriate technical scrutiny, over the entire lifecycle of the requirements from capability definition through capability realization and capability usage.

We have a near-term need for an UI/UX Designer to provide remote support to NATO-ACT.

Responsibilities

NATO ACT has adopted Agile DevSecOps principles emphasizing rapid, iterative delivery cycles and user-driven development. Many capability development efforts are software-intensive, while others integrate hardware and software into larger systems and services. Modern continuous integration and delivery toolsets are applied to ensure transparency, traceability, and responsiveness, allowing solutions to be developed, fielded, and refined quickly while remaining aligned with operational requirements. The growing demand for digital solutions has led to an expanding backlog of projects requiring sustained contractor support. Candidates are embedded within ACT’s cross-functional teams, working alongside staff in product-centric development efforts. These teams deliver Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) through rapid development cycles while simultaneously exploring emerging technologies that combine hardware and software integration. This dual-track approach ensures NATO can meet immediate operational needs while also experimenting withnovel solutions that strengthen long-term capabilities. To sustain and expand this capability, HQ SACT is seeking contractor support across multiple labor categories, including Solution Architects, DevSecOps Engineers, Full-Stack Developers, UI/UX Designers, Security Professionals, Acquisition and Contracting Specialists, Product Managers, Systems Engineers, Network Engineers, and Service Desk Operators. Candidates will be integrated into ACT teams under the guidance of the COTR, working within an Agile DevSecOps framework to deliver user-centric, operationally relevant solutions at speed. May require, at the direction of the COTR, to undertake official travel in support of ACT, both within and outside NATO boundaries, for a maximum of 30 days per year or as otherwise agreed. The UI/UX Designer will be specifically tasked with the following: support product teams by applying User-Centered Design (UCD) best practices throughout the software lifecycle. Engage with end users through the agile product development process to ensure solutions meet operational needs. Establish feedback loops with customers and apply the Build–Measure–Learn cycle to guide iterative product development. Conduct user research, including interviews, usability testing, and surveys, to validate design assumptions. Create design artifacts such as sketches, flows, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototypes. Ensure all design work complies with accessibility standards (WCAG, Section 508) and follows industry best practices for inclusive design. Collaborate with Product Managers on backlog refinement and prioritization to align design priorities with business value. Provide clarification to developers during implementation to ensure user expectations are met. Collaborate within cross-functional Agile/DevSecOps teams, actively participating in standups, demos, and retrospectives. Present and communicate design decisions effectively to stakeholders and senior leadership.

Qualifications

Required:
• Proven UI/UX industry experience on complex web and/or mobile application designprojects.
• Strong skills in user research, usability testing, and user-centered design methods.
• 3+ years of experience, with experience collaborating in Agile/DevSecOps environments including backlog refinement with Product Managers.
• Proficiency with modern design and prototyping tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, Axure, InVision).
• Knowledge and practical application of accessibility standards (WCAG, Section 508) and inclusive design principles.
• Experience producing deliverables such as wireframes, user flows, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups.
• Strong communication, facilitation, and stakeholder collaboration skills.
• Fluent in English (oral and written).
• Portfolio of work demonstrating past design solutions and methodology.
• Citizen of a NATO member nation.

Desired:
• Bachelor's degree in Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Human Factors, Human Centered Design/Engineering, or related discipline.
• Certification in UI/UX or related field (UI Design, UX Analyst, Human-Centered Design).

Title: Sr. UX designer/Product Designer Digital Experience Team (Onsite) || Newark, CA
Description:
Hi

Hope you are doing well !!

I have an urgent position. Kindly go through the Job description and let me know if this would be of interest to you.

Title : Sr. UX designer (Onsite)

Duration : 6+ Months

Location : Newark, CA

About the job

Senior Product Designer Digital Experience Team

We're looking for a Senior Product Designer who's great at juggling multiple projects and thrives in fast-changing environments. If you enjoy solving complex problems, working with different teams, and turning ideas into real solutions, this could be the role for you.

What You'll Be Doing
• Design for Both Worlds: Create tools for employees and experiences for customers.
• Collaborate Widely: Work with teams across the company-from shop floors to product teams.
• Clarify the Complex: Use visuals to align teams and drive progress.
• Prototype & Test: Turn ideas into designs and refine them through feedback.
• Influence Direction: Help shape product plans, service strategies, and tools.
• Tell the Story: Build clear, compelling presentations that explain your design thinking.
• Facilitate Workshops: Help plan and run Design Thinking sessions to align teams and spark ideas.

What We're Looking For
• You're a great listener and can connect the dots others might miss.
• You've got 6+ years of experience in design research, service design, or systems thinking.
• You're comfortable starting from scratch and figuring things out as you go.
• You can zoom out to see the big picture and zoom in to work on the details.
• You're just as happy talking to customers or staff as you are designing in Figma.
• You're a strong communicator and can bring different teams together around a shared vision.

Bonus Points If You Have
• Experience in the automotive world or other complex service industries.
• Familiarity with internal tools and systems that support employee workflows.

If you are interested, please share your updated resume and suggest the best number & time to connect with you

Thanks & Regards

US IT RECRUITER, DMS VISIONS INC
