Title: UI & UX Designer
Description:
UI & UX DesignerSolutionStream is a custom development shop that uses modern technology to build and design innovative software for our clients. When you become part of SolutionStream, you will work in different industries and disciplines, with companies ranging from start-up to enterprise level, while still maintaining a foundational team that will always have your back. We are an Agile company that has 25 years of diverse experience with expert-level designers, developers, and project managers. On each project, our teams use modern stacks, in-demand languages, and leading edge technologies to deliver quality products to our clients

SolutionStream offers employees competitive benefits packages which include 401K matching, premiere health/dental/vision insurance, paid overtime, rolling PTO, flexible schedules, and remote work options. Additionally, we are a family-inclusive business and we love to take every opportunity we can to spend time together outside of everyday project work. We hold frequent company activities including monthly BBQs (we love to grill), amusement park days, fun activities for out-of-state employees, team lunches, holiday gift giveaways, holiday parties, and movie premiere nights (we saw the new Marvel movies days before they were released).

We want you to join us!

What We’re Looking For
• Senior-Expert level knowledge of User Experience and User Interaction for software.
• Design tools like Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma and Invision.
• Collaborate with software developers, project managers, executive teams, product managers, and Client customers to create great user experiences for complex web/mobile products.
• Ability to create a website interface using HTML/CSS/JavaScript.

You Will Love Working Here If…
• You thrive in small business environments with opportunities to build relationships.
• You value varied experiences and love working in a fast-paced environment with changing projects and clients.
• You want to work in an ever-growing company with potential for customizable tasks and evolution within your position.
• You love playing games (video, board, and trivia varieties).
• You have a creative spirit with an analytical mind.
• You are a passionate nerd who likes to geek out about stuff you love.

Title: UI/ UX Designer
Description:
UI/ UX Designer

Must be US Citizen or Green Card holder

W-2 Full Time Salaried Position

100% Remote - Must reside in the US full time

Brandt Information Services is a leading provider of technology and marketing services for state wildlife and parks agencies, revolutionizing how agencies connect with and serve the public. From planning a camping trip to purchasing a hunting or fishing license, our solutions streamline the outdoor recreation experience. Every transaction — whether a boat registration, campground reservation, or educational event ticket—contributes to conservation efforts and enhances outdoor recreation opportunities.

The UI/UX Designer is responsible for collaborating with Brandt’s product and development teams to create and propose designs for new and existing features and workflows within our platforms. They are responsible for the "front" of front-end - implementing new design features and ensuring that the structure of our applications is correct and accessible. The UI / UX Designer takes direction from the UX lead to conduct UI/UX analyses, report recommendations to standardize and improve the user experience, and assist other team members with front-end needs. They possess excellent design skills, attention to detail, knowledge of usability principles and applying them to front-end development.

Job Responsibilities
• Planning & Execution: Engages with Scrum Teams throughout the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) to participate in design meetings for new features to understand requirements and create wireframes, mockups for release, and sprint priorities. Wireframes and mockups are high quality, adhere to Brandt's UI/UX standards, and align with industry customer types and user habits.
• Cross-functional Collaboration: Assists in maintaining documented design standards. Works with Development to facilitate adherence to standards by reviewing newly developed features, converting approved wireframes to finished, responsive UI utilizing HTML and CSS.
• Quality Assurance: Regularly monitors system changes and user workflows to identify areas of improvement or non-conforming designs. Ensures all aspects of the platforms are responsive, accessible, support a positive user experience, and follow ADA Requirements.
• Continuous Improvement: Keeps up-to-date with the latest front-end technology and trends. Conducts regular UI/UX studies on our platforms to identify ways to improve the overall user experience. Provides advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities to analyze and predict user behavior.

Job Competencies
• A portfolio of professional UI/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms.
• Working knowledge of design tools for mockups and prototyping (Adobe Creative Suite, or InVision / Figma).
• Solid understanding of usability and design principles with experience in developing wireframes or mockups for web and mobile solutions.
• Extensive knowledge of the software development process and corresponding technologies (HTML, CSS, Javascript).
• Basic understanding or experience with Git or similar version control.
• Goal-orientated, analytical, and good decision-making skills; the ability to prioritize tasks and manage their time effectively.
• Flexibility in the workplace, able to put ego aside to focus on the needs of the team and the customer.
• Outstanding collaboration and communication (written and verbal) skills are essential.

What You Will Need
• 3-4 years of experience in UI/UX design, development, or similar role.
• Proficient in the best practices for human-centered design and solving complex user requirements in wireframes and mockups.
• Understanding of building user tests to gather data and support work.
• Proficient in applying accessibility principles to shape the user-experience and design interfaces with accessibility in mind.
• Understanding of WCAG/Accessibility and applying them to frontend code, testing to correct issues.
• Demonstrated understanding of HTML/CSS and ability to follow established patterns and syntax when writing frontend code.
• Basic understanding of other frontend languages like Javascript.

Compensation & Benefits:

Here at Brandt, we understand that highly satisfied employees are key to a thriving company. This is why we offer:
• The selected candidate should have the skills, qualifications, and experience consistent with a Staff II level within Brandt’s job architecture. The compensation range is $85,000.00 - $100,000.00 with the final level and corresponding salary determined based on the candidate’s expertise, qualifications and prior experience within the applicable pay band.
• determined by factors including but not limited to skills, qualifications, and experience for this role.
• Health insurance with some plans fully covered for the employee (family members can be added at a discounted rate)
• Vision insurance fully covered for the employee (family members can be added at a discounted rate)
• Dental insurance available for purchase
• Flexible/Open paid time off (PTO) policy (available after 30 days of continuous service)
• Nine (9) paid holidays.
• 401k plan with matching company contributions
• Annual year-end performance bonuses
• Up to 8 weeks of paid parental leave
• Life insurance fully covered by the company.
• Long term disability insurance fully covered by the company.
• Free Udemy account for ongoing professional development and learning

Brandt Information Services, LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or other legally protected status.

Please direct all questions/inquires to careers@brandtinfo.com

Please: No External Agencies.

Title: Crypto UI/UX Designer (Athens-Remote) Job at Token Metrics Inc in Austin
Description:
Token Metrics is looking for a dynamic UI/UX Designer Intern who will be responsible for the UI and UX design of our various digital assets. You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design.

The UI/UX designer should have a passion for delivering adaptive and creative solutions to UI/UX design problems by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends in user experience design and user interface technology.
Responsibilities

Investigating user experience design requirements for our suite of digital assets.

Developing and conceptualizing a comprehensive UI/UX design strategy for the brand.

Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wire frames, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes.

Designing UI elements and tools such as navigation menus, search boxes, tabs, and widgets for our digital assets.

Testing UI elements such as CTAs, banners, page layouts, page designs, page flows, and target links for landing pages.

Collaborating with the marketing team, and internal and external designers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital user.

Providing advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities in order to analyze and predict user behavior.

Adhering to style standards on typography and graphic design.
Requirements

A Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 2 years of UI/UX design experience for digital products or services.

A portfolio of professional UI/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms.

Working knowledge of the following technologies and software: Sketch, InVision, Visio, HTML, CSS (SCSS), iOS, Android, Design Systems, and Adobe Creative Suite.

A team player but can work independently too.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.
About Token Metrics

Token Metrics is an AI-driven cryptocurrency research company that uses artificial intelligence to build Crypto indices, rankings, and price predictions.

Token Metrics has a diverse set of customers, from retail investors and traders to Crypto fund managers, in more than 50 countries.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: UI/UX Designer – Direct Response and Conversion Focused
Description:
Who we are.

Newfold Digital is a leading web technology company serving millions of customers globally. Our customers know us through our robust portfolio of brands. We have some of the industry's most prominent and storied go-to-market brands, including Bluehost and Network Solutions. We help customers of all sizes build a digital presence that delivers results. With our extensive product offerings and personalized support, we take pride in collaborating with our customers to serve their online presence needs. The strength of our company lives in the intersection of our people, our customers, and our brands.

This role is for someone who blends strong visual design skills with direct response thinking, crafting high-performing landing pages, funnels, and user flows that drive measurable business growth. You will design and optimize landing pages and user journeys specifically crafted to support direct response campaigns including email marketing, display ads, and social media. Your work will directly impact customer acquisition and conversion rates by aligning campaign creative with responsive, data-informed landing page experiences. You will be involved in end-to-end execution from initial concepts to testing and iteration, ensuring that every digital touchpoint drives action.

This is a hands-on role combining UX strategy, visual design, and performance-driven thinking. You will collaborate closely with marketing, content, and development teams to create on-brand experiences within platforms like Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), SaaS products, and e-commerce environments. Success in this position requires a deep understanding of conversion rate optimization, user behavior, and direct response psychology.

What you’ll do & how you’ll make your mark.
• Design and optimize landing pages tailored to specific direct response campaigns such as email, social, and display, ensuring visual alignment, message match, and frictionless user flow
• Translate marketing goals into high-converting UX and UI including page templates, lead generation forms, funnels, and calls to action
• Collaborate with digital marketers to ensure seamless pre-click and post-click experiences across channels
• Use data, A/B testing, user feedback, and analytics to iterate on designs and improve performance metrics including click-through rate, bounce rate, and conversion rate
• Design intuitive, accessible interfaces for responsive environments across SaaS and e-commerce platforms
• Build interactive wireframes and prototypes to clearly communicate ideas to stakeholders and drive alignment early in the development process
• Create user personas and journey maps to inform content and design strategies aligned with user intent
• Collaborate with development and content teams to implement and optimize designs in AEM including templates, modules, and reusable components
• Conduct usability testing and heuristic evaluations to identify barriers to conversion and recommend actionable design improvements
• Manage stakeholder expectations by clearly explaining design rationale supported by data and user behavior insights
• Maintain and evolve style guides, component libraries, and UX patterns to ensure consistency and scalability

Who you are & what you’ll need to succeed.
• Minimum of 5 years of UI/UX experience with a clear focus on conversion design in direct response marketing environments, ideally in SaaS or e-commerce
• Strong portfolio of landing pages, funnels, and campaign-driven designs that improved business performance
• Experience designing and optimizing experiences that support acquisition campaigns including email, social media, and digital advertising
• Proficiency in Figma and experience using project management tools such as Jira.
• Experience working within Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) to implement and refine UX solutions
• Deep understanding of conversion rate optimization tactics, UX best practices, and responsive design
• Proven experience conducting user research, building personas, and mapping conversion-focused customer journeys
• Familiarity with analytics tools such as Tableau and Adobe Analytics to support data-informed design decisions
• Knowledge of HTML/CSS for collaboration with development teams
• A strategic mindset that blends creativity with business acumen
• Passion for crafting exceptional user experiences that drive measurable business results
• Strong communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills
• Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, performance-driven environment with competing priorities

If you are motivated by results and passionate about building digital experiences that convert, we would love to hear from you.

Why you’ll love us.
• We’ve evolved; we provide three work environment scenarios. You can feel like a Newfolder in a work-from-home, hybrid, or work-from-the-office environment.
• Work-life balance. Our work is thrilling and meaningful, but we know balance is key to living well.
• We celebrate one another’s differences. We’re proud of our culture of diversity and inclusion. We foster a culture of belonging. Our company and customers benefit when employees bring their authentic selves to work. We have programs that bring us together on important issues and provide learning and development opportunities for all employees. We have 20 + affinity groups where you can network and connect with Newfolders globally.
• We care about you. We provide excellent Health Insurance options to fit you, HSA, Medical, Dental, Vision, Matching 401K, Life/AD&D/STD/LTD, Tuition Reimbursement, LinkedIn Learning, Pet Insurance, Generous Vacation policy, and much more!
• Where can we take you? We’re fans of helping our employees learn different aspects of the business, be challenged with new tasks, be mentored, and grow their careers. Unfold new possibilities with #teamnewfold!

Employment with Newfold Digital is at-will and nothing in this Job Description should be interpreted or construed to alter the at-will employment relationship.

Title: UI/UX Designer – Augmented Reality (AR) Smart Glasses Application
Description:
Location: Remote

Type: Contract / Freelance

Start Date: ASAP

Company: BANC3, Inc.

Application Email: recruitment@banc3.com

About the Role:

BANC3 is seeking a skilled UI/UX Designer to join our team on a contract basis to help design the user interface for an innovative Augmented Reality (AR) software application. The application is being developed for use on smart glasses.

At BANC3, we’re developing cutting-edge Augmented Reality (AR) applications for smart glasses, such as training for the DoD including the U.S. Air Force, Navy, Army and Space customers. We are looking for a creative UI/UX Designer to work alongside our strong tech development team — to help us craft an interface that’s intuitive, easy on the eyes, and optimized for real-world military environments. We are looking for a design expert who can help create a visual and interactive experience that is intuitive, clear, and optimized for mission-critical environments.

Responsibilities:
• * Design user-friendly, visually clear UI components for AR smart glasses.
• Create wireframes, interactive prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups.
• Focus on usability, legibility, and cognitive load in hands-free, heads-up displays.
• Collaborate closely with software developers to ensure design feasibility and accuracy.
• Iterate on user feedback from internal and field testing.

Required Qualifications:
• * Proven experience designing UI/UX for AR/VR, wearables, or mobile platforms (portfolio required).
• Strong understanding of spatial interface design and user-centered principles.
• Proficiency in tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar.
• Ability to design for environments with limited hand interaction and high information density.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
• * Experience with defense, aerospace, or industrial UX design.
• Familiarity with the unique constraints of military field operations.
• U.S. citizenship or ability to work with defense contractors.

Why Join BANC3?
• * Work on cutting-edge AR technology with real-world military applications.
• Collaborate with a highly skilled and innovative development team.
• Flexible remote work environment.
• Opportunity to help shape the future of AR user interfaces in mission-critical environments.

How to Apply:

Please send your resume and portfolio to recruitment@banc3.com We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: UX Designer (with Figma experience)
Description: UX Designer (with Figma experience) User Research and Analysis: Conduct user research through various methods (e.g., surveys, interviews, usability testing). Analyze user behavior and feedback to identify pain points and opportunities for improvement. Develop personas, journey maps, and use cases based on research findings. Information Architecture: Organize and structure information in a way that enhances the user's experience. Develop site maps, wireframes, and prototypes to outline the flow of the product. Interaction Design: Create interactive elements, ensuring they are intuitive and user-friendly. Design user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and mockups. Collaborate with UI designers to ensure cohesive and visually appealing interfaces. Usability Testing: Plan and conduct usability testing sessions to gather user feedback on design prototypes. Iterate designs based on testing results to improve usability and accessibility. Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to align on design goals and constraints. Present design concepts and user research findings to stakeholders. Collaborate with development teams during the implementation of designs to ensure a seamless transition.

Title: Mid-Level UX Designer - Contract, Remote (U.S.)
Description: UpTop is seeking experienced independent UX/UI design consultants to partner with us on a contract basis. As a collaborator with UpTop, you’ll contribute to a wide range of client projects using a design thinking mindset and lean UX methodology. We’re looking for versatile designers who can lead or support across the full UX spectrum—from research and conceptual design to prototyping and usability testing. We value partners who are Smart, Hungry, Humble, and always Curious—those who take initiative, deliver high-quality work, and collaborate well with diverse teams. What You'll Do: • Balance user needs, business goals, and technical constraints across various projects • Design intuitive, effective user interfaces following UX best practices for web and mobile platforms • Conduct project discovery, stakeholder interviews, and requirements gathering • Collect and analyze both qualitative and quantitative data to inform design direction • Plan and execute UX research: user interviews, journey mapping, surveys, card sorting, and tree testing • Create mid- to high-fidelity wireframes and interactive prototypes using Figma • Apply strong visual design fundamentals—typography, color, layout—while working within or expanding client brand systems • Deliver detailed design specifications including interaction states and annotations for development handoff • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams including client stakeholders, project managers, developers, and fellow designers What We’re Looking For • Independent contractors/freelancers with strong communication and client interaction skills • A collaborative mindset with the ability to self-manage and meet deadlines • Proficiency in user-centered design methodologies and iterative design practices • A sharp eye for detail with demonstrated visual design polish • Strategic and tactical design thinking across project phases • At least 5 years of UX/UI design experience, ideally with agencies, consultancies, or as a freelancer Additional Details • This is a contract opportunity for independent consultants (1099) who operate as registered business entities or LLCs; not a full-time employment position. • Work is fully remote (U.S.-based only) • You must be authorized to work in the U.S. We cannot sponsor or assume sponsorship of employment visas We pride ourselves as having a relaxed, fun and rewarding work environment. If you are passionate about all things technology and crave making an impact on a daily basis, please send your resume along with any compensation requirements to jobs@uptopcorp.com Apply tot his job Apply To this Job

Title: Senior UX Designer (Temporary)
Description:
Job Overview – Senior UX Designer (Temporary):

Compensation: $90/hour

Location: Middlesex County, MA

Schedule: Monday to Friday (Hybrid)

Atlantic Group is hiring a Senior UX Designer for our client in Middlesex County, MA. This temporary hybrid role focuses on creating digital experiences across web and cross-platform tools, including onboarding flows, portals, and dashboards. You will lead end-to-end projects, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and deliver wireframes, prototypes, and specifications using Figma, Adobe Creative Cloud, Miro, Confluence, and Jira.

Responsibilities as the Senior UX Designer:
• End-to-End Design: Lead discovery, strategy, and execution of digital experiences across web, mobile, and cross-platform solutions.
• User Advocacy & Research: Prioritize user needs, integrate research insights, and ensure compliance with accessibility, usability, and FDA guidance.
• Design Execution: Develop prototypes, flows, and design specifications using Figma, Adobe Creative Cloud, Miro, and other modern tools.
• Collaboration: Partner with product managers, engineers, marketers, and CX teams in agile environments to align strategy and delivery.
• System & Culture: Contribute to design system evolution, unify experiences across platforms, and mentor designers to strengthen UX culture.

Qualifications for the Senior UX Designer:
• Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, Computer Science, or a related field preferred.
• Experience: 5-8 years in UX or product design with a track record of delivering customer-focused digital products across web, mobile, and portal platforms.
• Technical Skills: Expert in Figma, Adobe Creative Cloud, and agile tools (Miro, Confluence, Jira) with advanced prototyping expertise.
• Industry Knowledge: Strong understanding of human-centered design, accessibility, responsive design, and regulated industry workflows, with healthcare or diabetes design experience preferred.
• Skills & Attributes: Strategic thinker with strong communication and problem-solving skills, able to align teams and excel in fast-paced environments.

Application Notice: Qualified candidates will be contacted within 2 business days of application. If an applicant does not meet the above criteria, Atlantic Group will keep your resume on file for future opportunities and may contact you for further discussion.

Title: UI/UX Designer | Onshore
Description:
Position: UI/UX Designer

Project Overview:

We are seeking a talented and passionate UI/UX Designer to join our team for a new and exciting project focused on enhancing the customer experience. This project will involve analyzing customer feedback, behavior, and business metrics to identify pain points and opportunities. The UI/UX Designer will be crucial in translating these insights into intuitive, engaging, and data-driven design solutions that will ultimately improve customer satisfaction, loyalty, and business performance.

Responsibilities:

User Research & Analysis:

Conduct user research to understand customer behaviors, needs, and motivations through methods like surveys, interviews, and usability testing.

Collaborate with data analysts and stakeholders to interpret customer experience data and translate it into actionable design insights.

Create user personas, journey maps, and user flows to visualize and communicate the customer experience.

Design & Prototyping:

Design and prototype intuitive and user-centered interfaces for web and mobile applications, focusing on key customer touchpoints (e.g., game-play experience, food and beverage ordering, loyalty program).

Develop wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes to effectively communicate design ideas.

Translate research findings and business requirements into effective design solutions.

Collaboration & Communication:

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, data analysts, engineers, and marketers, to ensure a cohesive and effective product design.

Present design concepts and rationale to stakeholders, incorporating feedback and iterating on designs.

Participate in brainstorming sessions and workshops to generate creative solutions to complex problems.

Qualifications:

Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing a range of projects and demonstrating your design process.

Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, or similar.

Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, information architecture, and usability best practices.

Experience with user research methods, including interviews, surveys, and usability testing.

Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.

Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, iterative environment.

A passion for the entertainment and hospitality industry is a plus.

Bonus Points:

Experience working on projects involving customer experience analysis and data-driven design.

Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and front-end development frameworks.

Experience with a/b testing and data analysis tools.

Familiarity with the brand and customer base.

Compensation, Benefits and Duration

Minimum Compensation: USD 50,000

Maximum Compensation: USD 175,000

Compensation is based on actual experience and qualifications of the candidate. The above is a reasonable and a good faith estimate for the role.

Medical, vision, and dental benefits, 401k retirement plan, variable pay/incentives, paid time off, and paid holidays are available for full time employees.

This position is available for independent contractors

No applications will be considered if received more than 120 days after the date of this post

Title: Senior UX Designer - Acton, Mass. (Hybrid)
Description:
Position Overview

Want to have an impact on Omnipod’s product design? Want to help lead a once in a lifetime career program? Be part of a highly engaged team who has a direct line to improving the product experience for people living with Diabetes! We are investing heavily to create a system to support the right experience at the right time and one that is scalable to the level of growth we expect. We need a strong Principle UX Designer to contribute to design to get us there, is this you?

The Sr UX Designer in the R&D group will be responsible for working closely with cross-functional members of the development teams to ensure a world-class product design for Omnipod’s Mobile App Suite. They will lead, plan and execute on strategic and tactical design initiatives for Android and iOS.

We are looking to hire a critical member of the team to be the Sr UX designer to lead large scale design initiatives for the core product applications. The goal for this role is drive best in class UX for Insulet, and act as senior individual contributor, working collaboratively with the software development, technical product management, systems team and qa in an agile environment.

We’re looking for someone who wants to use design to change the face of diabetes; someone who can innovate and translate a high-level vision into compelling digital experiences. If you are a creative thinker and positive team player with experience delivering world-class look and feel for mobile user experiences, we want you.

Sr UX Designer Responsibilities
• Lead tactical and innovation UX initiatives within an agile environment on mobile applications-Android and iOS. This includes working with Marketing, Technical Product Marketing and Systems teams to support requirements definition as it relates to UX to create a cohesive user experience across the apps space.
• Defining safe, effective and delightful user experiences for mobile experiences using industry standard tools such as Figma, Creative Cloud, Sketch, Zeplin, Overflow/Invision/Azure, etc. Delivery of said UX work with a variety of tools in an agile development environment- wireframes, asset delivery, GUI specifications, etc.
• Work in a fast-paced agile development team, who are located in - Boston, San Diego and Tijuana using MS Teams, JIRA, Confluence, Aha! And other collaboration tools.
• Lead UX discussions with key technical integration partners such as Glooko, Tidepool, etc. Understand their requirements, APIs and lead UX requirements including branding discussions.
• Work with User Research and Human Factors team to iteratively test early concepts and apply user centered design best practices to our work. Proactively engage with research to drive testing of your concepts.
• Present design concepts and user experience vision in a compelling and positive manner (with whiteboard sketches, storyboards, prototypes, wireframes or interactive presentations) to all levels of the company-from tactical agile software teams to executive leadership and to our customers.
• Collaborate heavily with Clinical and Human Factors to ensure our designs are safe and effective and meet FDA guidelines for a medical device experience but hold a high bar on how we can delight the user as well.
• Drive innovation initiatives related to UX process, tools or our overall design language and experiences.
• Collaborate with the multifunctional teams to help define world class user experiences and a holistic customer experience across touch points, primarily focused on the Omnipod product experience. This may include a variety of customer touchpoints- OOBE, web, mobile, product, integrations, other wearables, and including how it may integrate with the Global Customer Experience.
• Lead corporate UX design language development, standards and frameworks as our brand evolves.
• Mentor junior staff in all aspects of UX work. Invest in and support fellow UXers in their growth and development.
• Evangelize the role of UX design across the company.

Skills / Characteristics
• Strategic thinker and visionary with an equal passion to implement and execute
• Love a whiteboard and carry multiple colors of markers on you at all times
• Great storyteller both visually and verbally and can drive decision making at both strategic vision level and at a tactical feature level
• Builds and maintains positive relationships throughout the organization
• Creates a high-performance, a customer-centric culture throughout the organization, continuously monitors the needs of the customer
• Expert level expertise in articulating design decisions, take ownership, handle ambiguity, drive and lock down stakeholder alignment in a dynamic agile environment
• Charismatic, collaborative and creative leader who can articulate a vision, set direction and engage and motivate others to achieve outstanding results
• Influence key stakeholders in a collaborative manner to achieve the required outcomes
• Strong strategic focus with natural analytical skills and project execution capability that has been acquired and developed in a complex, international environment
• Sensitive to and can lead cross culturally and with distributed teams.
• Ability to manage conflict and pressure by effectively facilitating healthy interaction, discourse and decision making that builds consensus and alignment
• High level of business acumen and technical acumen
• Must demonstrate a passion for, and proven success in, driving continuous process improvement
• Demonstrates strategic thinking, finding innovative ways to serve customers and build trust
• Track record of elevating the capabilities of an organization for now, as well as the future

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree or Master’s (Psychology, Computer Science, HCI, Industrial Engineering, Interaction Design, Design, Human Factors or equivalent) required
• 7+ years of relevant experience in UX and product design, ideally with a focus on developing and implementing customer centric products, with multiple touchpoints (Product, mobile, web) globally
• Expert knowledge in Industry standard UX/Dev tools- Figma, Creative Cloud, Framer, Sketch, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc
• Fluent in usability standards and design heuristics and responsive design techniques.
• Expert knowledge of Android and iOS UI guidelines and platforms
• Strong portfolio required with strong storytelling and presentation skills
• 7+ years of experience working in an agile development environment
• Ability to collaborate cross functionally, specifically in areas of product development working closely with clinical partners such as Human Factors
• Strong technical hardware and software knowledge a plus
• Experience designing and launching product that meets accessibility standard is a strong plus Experience and demonstrated success in execution of mobile applications UX in either consumer or medical devices. Preference for experience working on medical devices or consumer wearables
• Working knowledge of User Research tools and methodologies and ability to work with researchers to drive research goals and objectives to drive user centered design approach
• Experience working effectively with cross-functional teams on high-visibility initiatives in a distributed environment-Boston, San Diego and Tijuana
• Intellectual curiosity, including the willingness to dig in and learn more about things
• Ability to prototype when necessary
• Thorough knowledge of the diabetes disease state preferred

Physical Requirements
• Ongoing US travel as needed (at least once per quarter)
• NOTE: This position is eligible for hybrid working arrangements and requires on-site work from an Insulet office.

Additional Information

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $115,950.00 - $173,925.00. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position in the primary work location in the US. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your Talent Acquisition Specialist can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process. Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits.

Insulet Corporation (NASDAQ: PODD), headquartered in Massachusetts, is an innovative medical device company dedicated to simplifying life for people with diabetes and other conditions through its Omnipod product platform. The Omnipod Insulin Management System provides a unique alternative to traditional insulin delivery methods. With its simple, wearable design, the tubeless disposable Pod provides up to three days of non-stop insulin delivery, without the need to see or handle a needle. Insulet’s flagship innovation, the Omnipod 5 Automated Insulin Delivery System, integrates with a continuous glucose monitor to manage blood sugar with no multiple daily injections, zero fingersticks, and can be controlled by a compatible personal smartphone in the U.S. or by the Omnipod 5 Controller. Insulet also leverages the unique design of its Pod by tailoring its Omnipod technology platform for the delivery of non-insulin subcutaneous drugs across other therapeutic areas. For more information, please visit insulet.com and omnipod.com.

We are looking for highly motivated, performance-driven individuals to be a part of our expanding team. We do this by hiring amazing people guided by shared values who exceed customer expectations. Our continued success depends on it!

At Insulet Corporation all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

(Know Your Rights)

Title: Principal UX Designer, GSR
Description:
Description

About Us

Amazon is looking to transform how consumers interact with digital content when it comes to shopping, interacting and organizing the actions of their daily lives. How can we make it better for our consumers, our customers? Our products serve millions of users globally across multiple platforms and devices. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and data-driven people. If you’d like to help us build this experience, this is your chance to make history.

We are hiring multiple roles across the Product and Design teams at Amazon in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle and New York. In this role, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders from Design, Product, and Marketing teams to shape product strategies and translate them into compelling creative assets and impactful visual experiences. This role requires strong visual and interaction expertise, experienced design practice, particularly in ambiguous environments where problems need to be discovered and defined. As a Principal Product Designer, you'll be a key driver in shaping the future of our products. You'll lead strategic design initiatives that directly impact our user experience, business growth, and product innovation. This role offers the opportunity to influence product direction at scale while mentoring the next generation of design talent.

Key job responsibilities

Strategic Leadership
• Define and execute long-term design strategy aligned with business objectives
• Identify opportunities for innovation and lead exploratory design initiatives
• Drive design thinking methodology across the organization
• Establish and evolve design standards and best practices
• Lead cross-functional collaboration with Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams

Design Excellence
• Own end-to-end design process for major product initiatives
• Create comprehensive design systems that scale
• Develop user flows, wireframes, and high-fidelity prototypes
• Ensure consistent, high-quality design implementation
• Pioneer new interaction patterns and visual frameworks

Research & Innovation
• Partner with research teams to gather actionable insights
• Conduct competitive analysis and market research
• Apply data analytics to inform design decisions
• Explore emerging technologies and their design implications
• Lead design sprints and innovation workshops

Team Leadership
• Mentor and develop junior designers
• Foster a culture of design excellence and innovation
• Lead design reviews and provide constructive feedback
• Build and maintain design team processes
• Collaborate with recruitment to grow the design team

A day in the life

Working Environment

Team Structure
• Report to Head of Design
• Work closely with Product and Engineering leadership
• Lead a team of designers
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams globally

Basic Qualifications

Required Qualifications

Experience
• 10+ years of product design experience
• Portfolio demonstrating complex problem-solving
• Track record of shipping successful digital products
• Experience leading design teams or major initiatives
• History of cross-functional collaboration

Technical Skills
• Expert knowledge of UI/UX design principles
• Proficiency in design and prototyping tools
• Understanding of technical constraints and possibilities
• Experience with design systems and pattern libraries
• Knowledge of accessibility standards

Leadership Skills
• Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• Proven ability to influence without authority
• Experience mentoring and developing others
• Track record of driving innovation

Preferred Qualifications

Preferred Qualifications
• Advanced degree in Design, HCI, or related field
• Experience with emerging technologies (AR/VR, AI/ML)
• Background in consumer-facing products
• International market experience
• Published articles or conference presentations
• Experience with agile development methodologies

Job ID: A2985990

Title: UX Designer (Site Optimization Specilaist) - CA, USA
Description:
Greetings Everyone

Who are we?

For the past 20 years, we have powered many Digital Experiences for the Fortune 500. Since 1999, we have grown from a few people to more than 4000 team members across the globe that are engaged in various Digital Modernization. For a brief 1 minute video about us, you can check https://youtu.be/uJWBWQZEA6o .

What will you do? What are we looking for?

Job Title : UX Designer - Site Optimization Specialist

Location : San Francisco – 4 days onsite, option of 1 day remote per week

Overview :

Our client is seeking a UX Designer with a passion for optimizing web experiences through data-driven insights and a focus on enhancing individual site components. This role will directly contribute to the continuous improvement of our digital platforms, working on incremental design changes that lead to impactful customer experiences. The ideal candidate will have a background in Human Factors , experience in B2C e-commerce , and a track record of utilizing A/B testing and user research to drive design decisions.

Key Responsibilities :
• Analyze user behavior and performance metrics to identify areas for improvement on our e-commerce website.
• Develop and execute A/B tests and rapid iterations based on data and customer feedback.
• Focus on refining individual site components (such as buttons, forms, and navigation elements) for better user interaction and conversion rates.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, Marketing, and Engineering, to ensure that design changes align with business goals.
• Conduct usability testing and heuristic evaluations to gather actionable insights for continuous site optimization.
• Utilize your knowledge of Human Factors to ensure designs are accessible, intuitive, and enhance overall user satisfaction.
• Present findings and design recommendations to senior leadership in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner to inform decision-making at the highest levels.
• Work closely with the analytics team to interpret data and translate insights into design improvements.

Required Skills :
• 5+ years of UX design experience with a focus on site optimization , preferably in a B2C retail environment.
• Strong proficiency in A/B testing , usability testing , and iterative design processes.
• Proven experience with data-driven design , leveraging insights to refine and optimize web experiences.
• Background in Human Factors , Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), or a related field.
• Expertise with Figma.
• Excellent presentation skills to effectively communicate insights and design solutions to senior leadership and stakeholders.
• Ability to communicate design rationale and collaborate with non-design stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications :
• Experience working in e-commerce environments.
• Familiarity with front-end development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) to better collaborate with engineering teams.
• Knowledge of Agile or Lean methodologies.

Why Us:

Join a team dedicated to crafting delightful and seamless user experiences. We offer a dynamic work environment where innovation is encouraged, and the impact of your work is felt by millions of customers worldwide. If you're passionate about UX design and site optimization and want to work in a company committed to quality and customer satisfaction, we want to hear from you.

Title: Staff UX Designer
Description:
The Role

We are looking for a Staff Product Designer to join a new product team at Fanatics Betting and Gaming. We are a balanced team of Product Managers, Product Designers, and Engineers who share a goal to pioneer new ways for fans to engage in sports and voice their fandom, and we are looking for talented people to join our team.

You’ll lead design projects of significant scope, complexity and responsibility in vision, strategy and execution, meaning limitless opportunities for you to turn your ideas into reality. You’ll collaborate closely with a multidisciplinary UX, product management and engineering team to frame user needs and behavior, define the optimal user flow and interactions, and ultimately deliver thoughtful and polished design work that is grounded in solid research.
What You’ll Be Doing

Lead key product initiatives within a cross-functional team, crafting high-quality and memorable fan experiences.

Work cross-functionally with Fanatics partner teams to capture elements of Fanatics digital properties inside Fanatics Betting and Gaming products, including e-commerce, ticketing/experiences, and future business verticals.

Craft the vision for the product experience by collaborating with your peers to identify new opportunities along with the outcomes, solution ideas, and assumption tests to gain confidence and support prioritization.

Apply strategic thinking to visualize ideas and concepts and communicate them effectively and compellingly for internal stakeholders, partners and customers

Build positive, collaborative relationships with product management, development, marketing, and the broader UX team, as well as continuously "raise the bar" as an effective leader of positive change.

Work with Product Managers and Software Engineers to discover, refine, develop, and ship features within an agile environment.

Facilitate cross-functional collaboration efforts like workshops & design sprints to generate and evaluate creative solutions.

Create detailed user flows, wireframes, etc., communicating UX clearly to relevant teams and the rationale for decisions that were made. Lead more junior designers in your feature area in the creation of high-quality deliverables that reflect high-quality thinking and decision-making.

Prototype user experiences and work with your UX Research team to coordinate and run qualitative and quantitative studies.

Offer efficient iteration based on feedback from internal stakeholders and UX research study results.

Clearly articulate the rationale behind your design choices and field feedback from your peers and stakeholders.

Capture and think through logical/implementable solutions for edge-cases and unhappy paths for engineering teams to build out.

Write and maintain UX documentation on design elements, patterns, layouts, and user flows, including usage guidelines and best practices.

Track the impact of your work via user feedback and data insights to help the team identify opportunities for continued iteration.

Maintain cohesion throughout Fanatics Betting & Gaming products by attending design team studio hours and supporting the work of your fellow experience enthusiasts.

What You Bring to the Role

6+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar role.

3+ years of experience leading large-scale initiatives and mentoring designers in your area of expertise.

A track record of designing high-quality digital products that delivered results and demonstrate the depth of your design skills; illustrated in a portfolio or case studies.

Expert knowledge of the end to end product design process, demonstrating a command of product strategy, distilling the jobs to be done for a given user, journey mapping, information architecture, interaction design, and user interface design.

Demonstrated communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills that clearly communicate complex concepts across different audiences and levels of the organization.

A proven ability to evaluate the customer and business impact of your design decisions inside and outside your own product area.

Deep experience with driving and applying user-centered design processes while working with cross-functional teams including development, product management, and product research

Experience conducting accessibility evaluations of components and/or page-level designs, excellent knowledge of accessibility guidelines (WCAG) and a track record of advocating for accessibility improvements and prioritization.

Excellent communication and storytelling skills; you have the ability to help your team and stakeholders understand the “why” behind your design rationale

You understand front-end code, the limitations of technology and have a deep understanding of the needs of engineers you’ve worked with previously.

You are curious and like to stay in tuned with the latest updates and techniques.

You are a teacher and like guiding others on best practices and latest techniques.

You are a proactive self-starter, systems thinker, comfortable with taking what is ambiguous and making it tangible by leveraging design thinking techniques.

Proficient in Figma as well as other design and prototyping tools.

Title: Senior UX Designer- Shopping Journey
Description:
• Must have a portfolio*

Must have e-commerce experience

Please only apply if you live in Chicago or plan to relocate there.

UX will help lead the design and definition as a key contributor to UX team, responsible for integrating human-centered practices in unpacking and improving the digital customer experience across all stages of the travel journey. The UX team supports defining digital product strategy and providing the leadership to execute on that strategy with the help of a cross-functional mission-based teams. We're looking for an empathic, passionate curious designer who celebrates delivering high-quality solutions and thrives for innovation in a collaborative environment.

PLAN & CONCEPT

• Visualize ideas using professional design tools as well as sticky notes, sketch boards, whiteboard markers or whatever tools are necessary to rapidly work through ideation and move to the next stage

• Initiate and respond to ideas for innovation/improvements based on research, analysis, and competitive reviews

• Identify user needs and business requirements

• Substantiate design approach with analysis & projections for improvements

DESIGN & REFINE

• Ensure digital customer touch points become and remain consistent with user experience and brand standards

• Develop intuitive, usable, and engaging interactions

• Drive the design of next generation, navigation schemes, patterns, components and templates across the company's products, insuring a consistent, appealing, and dynamic customer experience.

• Create low and high fidelity interactive prototypes adhering to a rapid, iterative and collaborative process

• Work with usability researchers to design test plans and iterate designs throughout user testing. Translate usability research findings into design improvements.

Education/Certification

• BA/BS or equivalent work experience required

Knowledge/Skills

• Solid grasp of web design principles and a good understanding of front-end web technologies required

• Excellent understanding of user experience design for the Web, mobile, and touch devices required

• Ability to coordinate, prioritize, and accomplish multiple tasks in a fast-paced atmosphere with minimal supervision required

• Experience in writing detailed design specifications (IA, work flow, page functionality and layout, etc.), which technology developers use to build the product required

• Must be a self-starter that can create schedules and define scope of work even when there are no clear requirements and direction required

• Strong ability to communicate your design, defend your design decisions, and respond quickly to business needs required

• Proven ability to set the design direction for your projects and to collaborate with other designers working in the space required

• A team player who can easily adapt in a rapidly changing environment required

Experience

• 5+ years professional UX design experience required

• 8+ years professional UX design experience preferred

Pay Range: $60-75/ HR W2

The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision and 401K contributions as well as any other PTO, sick leave, and other benefits mandated by appliable state or localities where you reside or work.
